newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Rebels deny starving refugees in eastern Zaire.
newsitem.headline: Rebels deny starving refugees in eastern Zaire.

text.p: Zaire's rebel alliance on Thursday rejected charges by United Nations Secretary General Kofi Annan that it was deliberately starving Rwandan refugees by blocking aid agency access to them.
Alliance "information minister" Raphael N'genda told reporters in Lubumbashi that it was up to the international community to provide the U.N. with the means to repatriate the refugees.
He said western powers had invested large numbers of men and aircraft in contingency plans for the evacuation of foreign nationals from Zaire's capital Kinshasa.
Why could they not do the same for starving Africans, he challenged.
N'genda said allegations that the rebel forces of Laurent Kabila were deliberately hampering refugee relief efforts were devoid of all foundation.
He said the U.N. chief must be misinformed, possibly by "vultures and jackals in the media" who camp around the refugees to record their suffering with "disgusting delight".
"The Alliance of Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Congo-Zaire...does not have a policy which consists in making life more difficult for the refugees," he said.
